page.title: 07 Pests on Furzen Farm
page.content: On the farm on the Addington Estate they suffer from pests.The pests they mainly get are rooks,pigeons, aphids and leatherjackets which turn into daddy longlegs.One year they sprayed the daddy longlegs.They found out that there were approximately five million leatherjackets per acre and they have one thousand and thirty two acres! The pigeons eat the corn when it has just been sown. The rooks eat the corn when it comes up.The aphids and leatherjackets get on the barley. The pests are not all living creatures.There are some fungal diseases like mildew. To kill off these pests, the farmer can spray for insects and fungal disease. At the farm they shoot pigeons,rooks and rabbits.
